headline.main: Why Did Ex-Lehman Executives Talk to Examiner?

docs.snippet: A day before Kenneth L. Lay, the former chairman of Enron, was indicted on fraud and conspiracy charges on July 7, about 100 of his former classmates at Hickman High School in Columbia, Mo., received an e-mail message in which he assured them that...
docs.lead_paragraph: A day before Kenneth L. Lay, the former chairman of Enron, was indicted on fraud and conspiracy charges on July 7, about 100 of his former classmates at Hickman High School in Columbia, Mo., received an e-mail message in which he assured them that his spirits were high. Mr. Lay wrote, ''God is stronger than all of the prosecutors, F.B.I. agents, S.E.C. investigators, other attorneys, etc. in the world,'' The Associated Press reported. He also apologized for ''causing so much commotion.''
docs.abstract: Washington Post reported last week that investigators reviewing Enron Corp's collapse found e-mail message from Enron lobbyists to former chairman Kenneth L Lay that said Rep Tom DeLay sought $100,000 in 'corporate and personal money' for redistricting in Texas; Republicans did gain control of Legislature, and redrew Congressional districts in their favor; Texas prohibits corporate financing of state campaigns; investigators are looking into report (S)

docs.snippet: Rebekah Rushing considered herself blessed. She received two job offers the day after she was laid off from Enron in December 2001, while thousands of other ex-employees were having trouble finding work.    So she started a charity, the Enron Ex-E...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rebekah Rushing considered herself blessed. She received two job offers the day after she was laid off from Enron in December 2001, while thousands of other ex-employees were having trouble finding work. So she started a charity, the Enron Ex-Employee Relief Fund Account, to help her former colleagues, depositing $90 in an account at the Humble Community Bank in Humble, Tex., and creating a Web site she hoped would attract small donations. ''I was expecting, you know, checks for $10 or $25,'' Ms. Rushing said.
docs.abstract: Charitable funds are set up to benefit former workers of bankrupt Enron Corp and WorldCom Inc, employee-victims of fraud and mismanagement; vast majority of money contributed to funds comes from politicians or their political action committees seeking to deflect fallout by handing over campaign contributions from two companies whose names are now synonymous with corporate greed, phony accounting and scandal; photos (M)

headline.main: Funds Aid Ex-Workers of Enron and WorldCom

docs.snippet: With Arthur Andersen now closing its doors, the remaining Final Four large accounting firms are girding for congressional and regulatory battles to determine whether any meaningful reforms will be imposed on the industry.    The industry's strateg...
docs.lead_paragraph: With Arthur Andersen now closing its doors, the remaining Final Four large accounting firms are girding for congressional and regulatory battles to determine whether any meaningful reforms will be imposed on the industry. The industry's strategy has been to paint the conviction of Andersen as ''a serious condemnation of the firm and its practices,'' as the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, which doubles as the accounting industry's lobbying arm and self-regulatory body, put it yesterday, rather than as an indication that reforms are needed.
docs.abstract: News analysis of outlook for accounting industry in light of Arthur Andersen verdict; with Andersen now closing its doors, remaining Final Four large accounting firms are girding for congressional and regulatory battles to determine whether any meaningful reforms will be imposed on industry (M)

headline.main: Verdict May Open Season of Reforms

docs.snippet: When the Enron Corporation filed for bankruptcy last December, its hopes for salvation rested largely on how much value it could extract from its old trading desk, the source of nearly all of its profits. Despite everything else that had happened,...
docs.lead_paragraph: When the Enron Corporation filed for bankruptcy last December, its hopes for salvation rested largely on how much value it could extract from its old trading desk, the source of nearly all of its profits. Despite everything else that had happened, Enron said, its previous deals were still highly valuable. But every time Enron looks inside the trading book that holds its most important secrets, it sees deals that are worth less and less. At the time of the bankruptcy filing, Enron said the book's value had fallen from $12 billion to roughly $7 billion after merger discussions with Dynegy broke down. That was plenty to get a $1.5 billion loan from J. P. Morgan Chase and Citigroup to help the company sustain itself for a while.
docs.abstract: Book value of Enron Corp's trading desk, source of nearly all of its profits, has plunged, in part because of changes in market during fall and winter and in part because desk reportedly sometimes exaggerated worth of deals to inflate profits; company's bankruptcy reorganization plan revolves almost entirely around generating cash by liquidating unit that houses trading desk and still owns book; Enron has sold trading desk to UBS for percentage of profits it generates; some creditors hope Enron is merely trying to lower expectations with its low estimates of book's current value; photo (M)

headline.main: What Was the Heart of Enron Keeps Shrinking

docs.snippet: It comes as no surprise that the Republican Party of Texas does not find the World Wide Web site www.EnronOwnsTheGOP.com as amusing as the Texas Democrats who run it.    But the Republicans say that is not why they are demanding that the site be s...
docs.lead_paragraph: It comes as no surprise that the Republican Party of Texas does not find the World Wide Web site www.EnronOwnsTheGOP.com as amusing as the Texas Democrats who run it. But the Republicans say that is not why they are demanding that the site be shut down.
docs.abstract: Texas Republican Party threatens legal action against World Wide Web site www.EnronOwnsTheGOP.com, which it says has misappropriated party's official site and registered trademark that appears there (S)

docs.snippet: President Bush told Americans tonight that ''our war against terror is only beginning'' and sent new warnings to terrorists around the world and to three nations -- Iran, Iraq and North Korea.     Using unusually strong language, he charged that '...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Bush told Americans tonight that ''our war against terror is only beginning'' and sent new warnings to terrorists around the world and to three nations -- Iran, Iraq and North Korea. Using unusually strong language, he charged that ''states like these and their terrorist allies constitute an axis of evil,'' choosing a word once used to describe the alliance of Germany, Italy and Japan during World War II.
docs.abstract: Pres Bush delivers his first State of the Union address, telling Americans that 'our war against terror is only beginning'; sends new warnings to terrorists around world and to three nations--Iran, Iraq and North Korea; using unusually strong language, Bush charges that 'states like these and their terrorist allies constitute axis of evil'; seems to outline rationale for future action, if deemed necessary, not only against terrorists but against any hostile states developing weapons of mass destruction; discloses new intelligence findings of plans by Al Qaeda terrorists to attack variety of US sites; vows to use national unity forged by war against terrorism toward twin causes of creating jobs for those worst hit by recession and promoting spirit of national service; talks of need to reform pension laws to protect workers, but does not mention Enron Corp by name; at emotional center of speech is America's gradual recovery from Sept 11; places priority on volunteer service and extending 'American compassion throughout the world'; photo (M)

headline.main: BUSH, FOCUSING ON TERRORISM, SAYS SECURE U.S. IS TOP PRIORITY
headline.kicker: THE STATE OF THE UNION: THE OVERVIEW

docs.snippet: Enron's attempt to quietly line up a big-name investor to demonstrate its financial strength seems to have backfired.    Overtures to several prominent investors have failed to turn up any takers, sending the stock to a new low yesterday. Uncertai...
docs.lead_paragraph: Enron's attempt to quietly line up a big-name investor to demonstrate its financial strength seems to have backfired. Overtures to several prominent investors have failed to turn up any takers, sending the stock to a new low yesterday. Uncertainty about the impact of Enron's troubles have also prompted one big energy trader to unwind some positions.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp's attempt to quietly line up big-name investor to demonstrate its financial strength seems to have backfired; overtures to several prominent investors have failed to turn up any takers, sending stock to new low of $9.67, down $1.50; uncertainty about impact of Enron's troubles prompts Apache Corp, big energy trader, to unwind some positions (M)

headline.main: Enron Looks for Investors, But Finds Them Skittish

byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and ANDREW ROSS SORKIN

docs.snippet: LOU L. PAI'S last assignment at Enron had all the hallmarks of a career maker.    As the chairman and chief executive of Enron Energy Services, Mr. Pai led the company's charge to become the nation's premier marketer of electricity to residential ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOU L. PAI'S last assignment at Enron had all the hallmarks of a career maker. As the chairman and chief executive of Enron Energy Services, Mr. Pai led the company's charge to become the nation's premier marketer of electricity to residential customers as states like California deregulated their utility industries. Oops. After an intensive, two-year campaign that sent Enron's stock on a roller-coaster ride, the company has declared retail electric sales a dead end for now.
docs.abstract: Lou L Pai, chairman of Enron Energy Services, is now promoting sale of electricity and natural gas to large commercial users, taking advantage of utility dergulation; photo; Enron's earlier, less successful, venture into retail electricity sales in California noted (S)

headline.main: A Culture of Trial, Despite Error

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation filed today with the Securities and Exchange Commission to make an initial public stock offering of its Azurix Corporation unit. The company said it planned to raise up to $750 million, or $863 million if the overallotment op...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation filed today with the Securities and Exchange Commission to make an initial public stock offering of its Azurix Corporation unit. The company said it planned to raise up to $750 million, or $863 million if the overallotment option was exercised. Azurix, which has headquarters in Houston and London, owns water and waste-water utilities in Britain and Latin America. Enron, based in Houston, supplies electricity and natural gas. It had revenue of $31.26 billion in 1998.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp files with Securities and Exchange Commission to make initial public stock offering of its Azurix Corp unit; says it plans to raise up to $750 million, or $863 million if overallotment option is exercised (S)
